page.title: 05FINGHALL (ctd.)
page.content:
There are now about 40 houses in the village and 4 farms.Some other houses are currently being built.There is a Post Office which also sells icecream and sweets;and a small village shop. There is a public house which is called "The Queen's Head".
At the top of the bank is a gravel heap for use in the bad weather.In addition there is a telephone box.There are 2 Wesleyan Chapels,one of which is in ruins,the other,built in 1910,is still in use.
One of the older houses,built in the reign of Queen Anne,and once used as a rectory,has a large garden.In the garden are the remains of 2 large fish ponds.They are no longer used and there is very little water in them.
